shows.title: Preventing Spiritual Attacks / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Bill Bean, known as the Spiritual Warrior, will share his personal story and talk about his career as an exorcist and minister. He'll explain the 15 warning signs of a possible spiritual attack and will pass along information on how to prevent it from happening. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half—give George a call and discuss whatever's on your mind!

shows.title: ET Contacts / Spirit Frequencies
shows.first_half: Spiritual thought leader Aaron Abke joins guest host Rich Berra (email) to explore ET intelligence and the shifts in human consciousness required for meaningful contact. He'll reveal why some ETs are benevolent, and others are not, and how negative entities operate through deception. Followed by psychic medium and spiritual teacher Bill Philipps on the unseen ways in which spirit and frequency shape our thoughts, emotions, and well-being. He'll also delve into music’s role in awareness of the Other Side.
shows.second_half: From 6-10pm PT, Art Bell: Somewhere in Time returns to 2/9/96 when money expert Andy Gause spoke about the national debt and investing.

shows.title: Animal Rights / High Strangeness at Colorado Ranch
shows.first_half: First Half: Wayne Pacelle is the President of the Center for a Humane Economy and the All-Life Institute. He joins George Knapp to discuss animal rights, including protecting wolves, shutting down the trafficking of American horses for human consumption, and stopping the government’s plan to conduct mass slaughter of barred owls.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author Katie Paige will speak about the historical significance of the Rocky Mountain Ranch in Colorado, its place in early UFO research archives, and the reports of "high strangeness" that have taken place there.

shows.title: Civilization Catastrophe / Patterson-Gimlin Film
shows.first_half: First Half: Researcher with extensive experience in aerospace and robotics, Charles Shults III, discusses how rapid advances in AI could push humanity toward a potentially catastrophic turning point. He examines the concept known as the Great Filter, a term used by SETI Institute researchers to describe a possible barrier in cosmic evolution.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Sasquatch researcher M.K. Davis talks about his latest work on the evidence for Bigfoot. He'll focus particularly on the Patterson-Gimlin film, highlighting his progress in examining various aspects of the iconic 1967 footage.

shows.title: Economic Forecast / Police Paranormal Encounters
shows.guests: Harry S. Dent, Marianne Robb, Dave Rich
shows.first_half: First Half: Financial advisor Harry S. Dent Jr. shares his outlook on the U.S. and global economies after 16 years of unprecedented stimulus. He examines whether the post-2008 recovery is sustainable, the potential cost of prolonged artificial support, and which investments may fare best in a possible near-term crash and recession.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Retired police officers Marianne Robb and Dave Rich discuss the stigmas that first responders face when encountering such things as UFOs, paranormal events, and cryptids. They'll reveal the stories from their service days that they have never shared with anyone.

shows.title: Ancient Mystics / UFOs & Aliens
shows.first_half: First Half: Author and lecturer Ken Hanson will discuss the mysterious ancient mystics known by some as the Visionaries and by others as the Enochians. Long before UFO stories, ancient Israelites were telling tales of beings who came down from the sky, taught forbidden knowledge, and nearly destroyed the world.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Filmmaker and casting director Craig Campobasso will delve into UFOs and aliens, including reports of 82 distinct races of ETs. He'll also share intriguing findings from his latest book, The UFO Hotspot Compendium, including the best places to see a UFO.

shows.title: Space Program & ETs / Wildlife Conservation
shows.guests: Brooks Agnew, Cheryll Jones, David McChesney
shows.first_half: First Half: Author and multi-patented engineer Brooks Agnew will talk about the current state of the space program, the latest in UFO disclosure, and the alien presence on planet Earth.
shows.second_half: Second Half: C2C's investigative reporter Cheryll Jones presents her interview with photographer, author, and conservationist David McChesney, known for his captivating wildlife photography used to help save and protect select species and environmental areas. In the last hour, McChesney will take live calls with Cheryll and George.

shows.title: Hauntings & Folklore / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Folklorist, historian, and paranormal researcher Rissa Miller will share how a childhood ghost sighting set her on a lifelong path of uncovering hidden stories. She believes that history, folklore, and the supernatural are not separate realms, but overlapping forces that echo and inform one another. Drawing on years of research and fieldwork, she'll discuss her investigations into haunted houses and cemeteries, as well as her exploration of urban legends, cryptids, and the enduring traditions of witchcraft and magic. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half. Give George a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!
